intro: Ficaria peloponnesiaca, commonly known as the Peloponnesian ficaria, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many other flowering plants with small, cruciform flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to dry, sunny environments. Its flowers are usually white or pale yellow, and it produces small, rounded pods containing seeds. Ficaria peloponnesiaca is often found in coastal areas and is considered a rare and endemic species.
